result.execSummary:
The defendant Nameer E Lewis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
*Court will allow transfer to Racine County, pending approval.
*Probation review hearing scheduled for 12/04/15 at 1:30pm.

miscConds.notes:
*Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
*Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
*DNA surcharge was waived as no sample was taken.

*NO firearms; weapons.
*Due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

*No use of controlled substances without a prescription.
*No contact with victim without approval of the agent, other than contact at church or church-related activities.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.

*Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
*Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

*Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: *Time is stayed pending review on 12/04/15 at 1:30pm.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Count 2 conditions apply except for condition time.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nameer E Lewis in court.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Nameer E Lewis in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.
AS TO COUNT 2:
Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
AS TO COUNT 3:
Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction concurrent with count 2.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety, no use of controlled substances without a prescription.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim without approval of the agent, other than contact at church or church-related activities.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
-Court will allow transfer to Racine County, pending approval.
-DNA surcharge was waived as no sample was taken.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
No Contact Order AMENDED as follows: Contact allowed at church and church-related activities ONLY.

Defendant Nameer E Lewis in court with Attorney Alexis B Stewart.  
Owen M. Piotrowski for Kristin Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.


Matter scheduled for Jury Trial on today before Branch 40. *CASE HEARD BY BRANCH 44 FOR BRANCH 40* Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined by the Court as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  

AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations, and on state's motion the Court orders Count 1 DISMISSED AND READ-IN for the purpose of sentencing in Counts 2 and 3.

Victim requests to be heard as to No-contact order.  Statement made by Tatrianna H., the state, and defense.  The Court AMENDS no contact order to allow for contact at church and church-related activities ONLY.  Case to return to Branch 40 for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Statements made by: Tatrianna H. Court denies request to modify the No Contact Order.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Nameer E Lewis in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Defense requests Jury Trial date.  Jury trial scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am in Branch 40.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.

Defendant Nameer E Lewis in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TATRIANNA H.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Nameer E Lewis in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Defendant Nameer E Lewis in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant plead not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNTS 2 & 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DALLET, Branch 40.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE for BRANCH 40.  Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing TO ACCOMODATE DEFENDANT.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
